The report focused on civic engagement a: 29 year olds and analyzed data from the U.S. Census Bureau and the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
The report found that 62: 9 percent of 18-29 year olds were currently employed, of which 31.2 percent worked on a part-time basis.
A co: author of the report clarified that the claim's interpretation was incorrect, as only a slightly less than a third of those employed in the age group worked part-time. Additionally, updated data from the U.S. Census Bureau showed that 42 percent of people aged 18-29 had full-time jobs.
